fr.lip6.jkernelmachines.classifier

Interface MKL<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GradMKL, SimpleMKL, TSMKL

    public interface MKL<T>
    Interface for Multiple Kernel Classes. Provides useful methods for retrieveing multiple kernels related information.
    Author:
    picard

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addKernel(Kernel<T> kernel)
      Adds a kernel to the MKL problem
      java.util.List<Kernel<T>> getKernels()
      Gets an array of the kernels in the set, in the same order as getKernelWeights()
      java.util.Map<Kernel<T>,java.lang.Double> getKernelWeightMap()
      Gets a mapping of pairs containing the kernels and weights in the set.
      double[] getKernelWeights()
      Gets an array containing the weights of the different kernels, in the same order as getKernels()

    • Method Detail

      • addKernel

        void addKernel(Kernel<T> kernel)
        Adds a kernel to the MKL problem
        Parameters:
        kernel - the new kernel to add

      • getKernelWeights

        double[] getKernelWeights()
        Gets an array containing the weights of the different kernels, in the same order as getKernels()
        Returns:
        the array of weights

      • getKernels

        java.util.List<Kernel<T>> getKernels()
        Gets an array of the kernels in the set, in the same order as getKernelWeights()
        Returns:
        the array of kernels

      • getKernelWeightMap

        java.util.Map<Kernel<T>,java.lang.Double> getKernelWeightMap()
        Gets a mapping of pairs containing the kernels and weights in the set.
        Returns:
        the map of pairs
